Detailed Description

ECC100 DLL.

Defines functions for connecting and controlling the ECC100

Definition in file ecc.h.

Define Documentation

#define NCB_API   __declspec(dllimport) _stdcall

Definitions for the windows DLL interface.

For external use of this header

Return values of functions.

No error

Actor is of rotator type.

Function Documentation

Int32 NCB_API ECC_Check ( EccInfo **  info  ) 

Check devices.

Checks whether the USB driver is accessible and how many devices are connected. The function returns with a pointer to an array of struct EccInfo. The return code tells how many devices were found (and so how many elements the array contains). The struct contains information wheteher a device is accessible (unlocked) or is already in use by someone else (locked). The device ID is a number programmed by the user to distinguish between multiple devices. It is valid only if the device is unlocked.

The function must not be called as long as a device is connected by ECC_Connect.

Parameters:
info Output: Pointer to array of struct 'EccInfo'. The parameter may be NULL to ignore the devices array.
Returns:
Count of found devices
Int32 NCB_API ECC_Close ( Int32  deviceHandle  ) 

Close connection.

Closes the connection to the device.

Parameters:
deviceHandle,: Handle of device
Returns:
Result: NCB_Ok (exclusive result value)
Int32 NCB_API ECC_Connect ( Int32  deviceNo,
Int32 *  deviceHandle 
)

Connect device.

Initializes and connects the selected ECC (0..n). This has to be done before any other function (except ECC_Check and ECC_ReleaseInfo) can be called. The returned handle is used to address the device in further communication.

Parameters:
deviceNo,: Index of the device to connect (0..n)
deviceHandle,: Pointer to (user)memory which will retrieve the Handle.
Returns:
Result of function

Int32 NCB_API ECC_controlContinousBkwd ( Int32  deviceHandle,
Int32  axis,
Bln32 *  enable,
Bln32  set 
)

Control continous movement backward.

Controls continous movement in backward direction. If enabled a potential present movement in the opposite direction is stopped. The parameter "false" stops all movement of the axis regardless its direction.

Parameters:
deviceHandle Handle of device
axis Number of the axis to be configured
enable Enables/ disables the movement
set 1: Send the supplied values to the controller 0: Ignore input; only retreive the results
Returns:
Result of function

Int32 NCB_API ECC_controlEotOutputDeactive ( Int32  deviceHandle,
Int32  axis,
Bln32 *  enable,
Bln32  set 
)

Output deactivate on EOT.

Defines the behavior of the output on EOT. If enabled, the output of the axis will be deactivated on positive EOT detection.

Parameters:
deviceHandle Handle of device
axis Number of the axis to be configured
enable true: Output will be deactiveted on EOT. false: Output stays active on EOT
set 1: Send the supplied values to the controller 0: Ignore input; only retreive the results
Returns:
Result of function

Int32 NCB_API ECC_controlReferenceAutoUpdate ( Int32  deviceHandle,
Int32  axis,
Bln32 *  enable,
Bln32  set 
)

Reference Auto Update.

When set, every time the reference marking is hit the reference position will be updated. When this function is disabled, the reference marking will be considered only the first time and after then ignored.

Parameters:
deviceHandle Handle of device
axis Number of the axis to be configured
enable enable/disable auto update
set 1: Send the supplied values to the controller 0: Ignore input; only retreive the results
Returns:
Result of function

Int32 NCB_API ECC_getDeviceInfo ( Int32  deviceNo,
Int32 *  devId,
Bln32 *  locked 
)

Inquire device properties.

The function provides an alternative (and more labview friendly) way to inspect the devices found by ECC_Check . It returns the locking state and device ID as provided in the info array of ECC_Check .

Parameters:
deviceNo Index of the device, must be smaller than the number of found devices.
devId Output: Device ID, only valid if unlocked.
locked Output: Locking state.

Int32 NCB_API ECC_getStatusMoving ( Int32  deviceHandle,
Int32  axis,
Int32 *  moving 
)

Moving status.

Retrieves the status of the output stage. Moving means the actor is actively driven by the output stage either for approaching or continous/single stepping and the output is active. Pending means the output stage is driving but the output is deactivted i.e. by EOT or ECC_controlOutput.

Parameters:
deviceHandle Handle of device
axis Number of the axis to be configured
moving Moving status, 0: Idle; 1: Moving; 2: Pending
Returns:
Result of function
Int32 NCB_API ECC_getStatusReference ( Int32  deviceHandle,
Int32  axis,
Bln32 *  valid 
)

Reference status.

Retrieves the status of the reference position. It may be valid or invalid.

Parameters:
deviceHandle Handle of device
axis Number of the axis to be configured
valid Status of the reference position.
Returns:
Result of function

Int32 NCB_API ECC_setSaveParams ( Int32  deviceHandle  ) 

Save params.

Saves user parameters to persistant flash in controller. Parameters that will be saved are amplitude, frequency and actor selection of each axis.

Parameters:
deviceHandle Handle of device
Returns:
Result of function

Int32  axis,
Bln32  backward 
)

Single step.
